title: Peppered Moths: Evolution You Can See
description: A 60-second lesson on Peppered Moths: Evolution You Can See.

hook.text: In 1800s England, white moths turned black â€” then turned back. Evolution happened in decades.

buildup.text: Before the Industrial Revolution, light-colored peppered moths blended into pale tree bark.

discovery.text: Soot darkened the trees. Dark moths now had camouflage. Light ones were eaten by birds.

twist.text: When clean air laws reduced soot, trees lightened â€” and light moths regained their advantage.

climax.text: Within decades, the population shifted back. Evolution reversed direction based on the environment.

punchline.text: Moth color changed with factory smoke. Evolution doesn't wait for millions of years.

quiz.question: Why did dark peppered moths become dominant during the Industrial Revolution?
options: Soot-darkened trees gave them better camouflage
